com.tinkerpop.gremlin.process

Interface Traverser.Admin<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.util.detached.Attachable<Traverser.Admin<T>>, Comparable<Traverser<T>>, Serializable, Traverser<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyTraverser
    Enclosing interface:
    Traverser<T>

    public static interface Traverser.Admin<T>
extends Traverser<T>, com.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.util.detached.Attachable<Traverser.Admin<T>>
    The methods in System.Traverser are useful to underlying Step and Traversal implementations. They should not be accessed by the user during lambda-based manipulations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.tinkerpop.gremlin.process.Traverser

        Traverser.Admin<T>

    • Field Detail

      • HALT

        static final String HALT

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        void merge(Traverser.Admin<?> other)
        When two traversers are Traverser#equals to each other, then they can be merged. This method is used to merge the traversers into a single traverser. This is used for optimization where instead of enumerating all traversers, they can be counted.
        Parameters:
        other - the other traverser to merge into this traverser. Once merged, the other can be garbage collected.

      • split

        <R> Traverser.Admin<R> split(String label,
                             R r)
        Generate a child traverser of the current traverser for current as step and new object location. The child has the path history, future, and loop information of the parent. The child extends that path history with the current as and provided R-object.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The current object type of the child
        Parameters:
        label - The current label of the child
        r - The current object of the child
        Returns:
        The split traverser

      • split

        Traverser.Admin<T> split()
        Generate a sibling traverser of the current traverser with a full copy of all state within the sibling.
        Returns:
        The split traverser

      • set

        void set(T t)
        Set the current object location of the traverser.
        Parameters:
        t - The current object of the traverser

      • setPath

        void setPath(Path path)
        Set the path of the traverser. Typically used for serialization reasons when propagating traversers across machine boundaries.
        Parameters:
        path - The new path of the traverser

      • incrLoops

        void incrLoops()
        Increment the number of times the traverser has gone through a looping section of traversal.

      • resetLoops

        void resetLoops()
        Set the number of times the traverser has gone through a loop back to 0. When a traverser exits a looping construct, this method should be called.

      • getFuture

        String getFuture()
        Return the future step of the traverser as signified by the steps as-label. This is typically used in multi-machine systems that require the movement of traversers between different traversal instances.
        Returns:
        The future step for the traverser

      • setFuture

        void setFuture(String label)
        Set the future of the traverser as signified by the step's label. If the future is HALT, then isHalted() is true.
        Parameters:
        label - The future labeled step of the traverser

      • setBulk

        void setBulk(long count)
        Set the number of traversers represented by this traverser.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of traversers

      • isHalted

        default boolean isHalted()
        If the traverser has "no future" then it is done with its lifecycle. This does not mean that the traverser is "dead," only that it has successfully passed through the Traversal.
        Returns:
        Whether the traverser is done executing or not

      • detach

        Traverser.Admin<T> detach()
        Prepare the traverser for migration across a JVM boundary.
        Returns:
        The deflated traverser

      • attach

        Traverser.Admin<T> attach(Vertex hostVertex)
        Regenerate the detached traverser given its location at a particular vertex.
        Specified by:
        attach in interface com.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.util.detached.Attachable<Traverser.Admin<T>>
        Parameters:
        hostVertex - The vertex that is hosting the traverser
        Returns:
        The inflated traverser

      • attach

        default Traverser.Admin<T> attach(Graph graph)
                           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Traversers can not attach to graphs and thus, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        attach in interface com.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.util.detached.Attachable<Traverser.Admin<T>>
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph to attach the traverser to, which it can't.
        Returns:
        nothing as an exception is thrown
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - is always thrown as it makes no sense to attach a traverser to a graph

      • setSideEffects

        void setSideEffects(Traversal.SideEffects sideEffects)
        Set the sideEffects of the Traversal. Given that traversers can move between machines, it may be important to re-set this when the traverser crosses machine boundaries.
        Parameters:
        sideEffects - the sideEffects of the traversal.
